20101222180039.000|20101222180041.000|TR0|bill today, Don't Ask, Don't Tell. Now and 
20101222180041.000|20101222180043.000|TR0|inglorious part of US history.  The law 
20101222180043.000|20101222180046.000|TR0|that had prevented gays and lesbians from 
20101222180046.000|20101222180048.000|TR0|serving openly in the military had been a 
20101222180048.000|20101222180050.000|TR0|stigma over the nation for years.  It 
20101222180050.000|20101222180052.000|TR0|forced thousands of men and women to leave 
20101222180052.000|20101222180055.000|TR0|the military they loved and served with 
20101222180055.000|20101222180057.000|TR0|honor.  Earlier today, President Obama 
20101222180057.000|20101222180059.000|TR0|fulfilled a campaign promise to repeal the 
20101222180059.000|20101222180102.000|TR0|ban.

20101222180234.000|20101222180236.000|TR0|to 1,550 launchers to 700. Now, by

20101222181002.000|20101222181004.000|TR0|development, especially, since republicans 
20101222181004.000|20101222181007.000|TR0|led by that - led by Tom Coburn had said 
20101222181007.000|20101222181009.000|TR0|that they did not like this, specifically,

20101222183007.000|20101222183009.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT (voice-over): Jeff Cadavona

20101222183012.000|20101222183014.000|TR0|long before "don't ask, don't tell." Back

20101222183016.000|20101222183019.000|TR0|serving. And Jeff, who was in the Air 
20101222183019.000|20101222183021.000|TR0|Force and not open about his sexuality,

20101222183023.000|20101222183025.000|TR0|
20101222183025.000|20101222183028.000|TR0|JEFF CADAVONA, U.S. AIR FORCE (RET.): When
